metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4456 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ownCloud Desktop Client before 1.8.2 does not call QNetworkReply::ignoreSslErrors with the list of errors to be ignored, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to bypass the user's certificate distrust decision and obtain sensitive information by leveraging a self-signed certificate and a connection to a server using its own self-signed certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libowncloudsync0 - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
nautilus-owncloud - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-cmd - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
owncloud-client-l10n - 2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: owncloud-client package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
